Description: Ovoid marl pottery jar with flat base, ledge rim and two cylindrical pierced handles on the shoulder, decorated in red-brown paint with two boats, two fan-shaped bushes and s-motifs. Wavy lines are painted above and over the handles; there is a spiral on the base.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D43K in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). One boat has as double triangle standard; the other is obscured by wear. Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 335.
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
